segment.source: This topic shows how to launch an interstitial ad using C#.
segment.target: This topic shows how to launch an interstitial ad using C#.

segment.source: For step-by-step instructions that show how to configure your project to use this code, see Interstitial ads.
segment.target: For step-by-step instructions that show how to configure your project to use this code, see Interstitial ads.

segment.source: For a complete sample project that demonstrates how to add video interstitial ads to a XAML app using C#, see the advertising samples on GitHub.
segment.target: For a complete sample project that demonstrates how to add video interstitial ads to a XAML app using C#, see the advertising samples on GitHub.

segment.source: This code sample shows a working MainPage.xaml.cs code file that implements an interstitial ad.
segment.target: This code sample shows a working MainPage.xaml.cs code file that implements an interstitial ad.

segment.source: This code assumes that the MainPage.xaml file has a working button with a Click event that fires and is handled by a method named button_Click.
segment.target: This code assumes that the MainPage.xaml file has a working button with a Click event that fires and is handled by a method named button_Click.

segment.source: This code launches the interstitial ad when the Click event on the button is fired.
segment.target: This code launches the interstitial ad when the Click event on the button is fired.

segment.source: Replace the text in the AppID and AdUnitId variables with live values before submitting your app to the Store.
segment.target: Replace the text in the AppID and AdUnitId variables with live values before submitting your app to the Store.

segment.source: For more information, see Set up ad units in your app.
segment.target: For more information, see Set up ad units in your app.
